item.title: Fly Tipping and Litter, 10th September
item.description:
Can we please get something done about the depressing build-up of litter and fly tipping on the approach to the subway from the Bramshot Ave side. It makes an already intimidating and depressing approach even more.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 27, Bramshot Avenue, East Greenwich, London

item.title: 2 bollards have been ripped out the pavement on the SW corner of Minet Road and Lilford Road junction., 10th September
item.description:
The bollards were knocked over by a truck at around 4am on or around the 21st August 2025 leaving the paving bricks/slabs scattered around the holes. The bollards are completely missing and assume they were taken by the vehicle causing the damage. The holes and debris are a hazard to pedestrians.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lilford Road, Loughborough Junction, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: For the 3rd time you have not removed the fly-tip, 10th September
item.description:
Originally reported last month see 8053416. - i don't get why you say "resolved" when it's never been cleared, the 2nd pic is from that report. The first photo is today. see 8143964. which you have put as Fixed at 13.00 today, but how weird, the flytip is EXACTLY THE SAME STILL at 18.30 today

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Market Place, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet
